title: Recycling
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental protection - Citizen participation
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Waste products
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Recycling (Waste, etc.)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental education
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental policy
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Public opinion
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Community power
description: Shows existing techniques for recovering materials from solid waste and describes the newly developed equipment and systems which may make recycling a universal project in the future. The pressure of public opinion in favour of recycling is enormous, nevertheless it is actually practised very little.
